mnkgame

Interface MNKPlayer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    QuasiRandomPlayer, RandomPlayer

    public interface MNKPlayer
    Interface for a (M,N,K)-game software player.

    The implementing classes need to provide a constructor that takes no arguments. The MNKPlayer is initialized through the initPlayer method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void initPlayer(int M, int N, int K, boolean first)
      Initialize the (M,N,K) Player
      java.lang.String playerName()
      Returns the player name
      MNKCell selectCell(MNKCell[] FC, MNKCell[] MC)
      Select a position among those listed in the FC array

    • Method Detail

      • initPlayer

        void initPlayer(int M,
                int N,
                int K,
                boolean first)
        Initialize the (M,N,K) Player
        Parameters:
        M - Board rows
        N - Board columns
        K - Number of symbols to be aligned (horizontally, vertically, diagonally) for a win
        first - True if it is the first player, False otherwise

      • selectCell

        MNKCell selectCell(MNKCell[] FC,
                   MNKCell[] MC)
        Select a position among those listed in the FC array
        Parameters:
        FC - Free Cells: array of free cells
        MC - Marked Cells: array of already marked cells, ordered with respect to the game moves (first move is in the first position, etc)
        Returns:
        an element of FC

      • playerName

        java.lang.String playerName()
        Returns the player name
        Returns:
        string
